name.text: ICoLearn - Internet and collaborative based learning methodologies toolbox for digital transformation and sustainable growth |<b> Project No.: 101127224

accordion.t1: Year of foundation: 1906: The Polytechnic of Turin was officially founded in 1906, although its roots go back even further. It evolved from the earlier Technical School of Engineers (founded in 1859).
accordion.t4: Engineering: Aerospace, Automotive, Biomedical, Chemical, Civil, Computer Science, Electrical, Electronics, Energy, Environmental, Management, Mechanical, Mechatronics, Nuclear, Physics, Telecommunications
accordion.t12: Department of Environmental, Territorial and Infrastructure Engineering (DIATI)
accordion.t13: Department of Applied Science and Technology (DISAT)
accordion.t14: Department of Management and Production Engineering (DIGEP)
accordion.t15: Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering (DIMEAS)
accordion.t16: Interdepartmental Department of Regional and Urban Studies and Planning (DIST)
accordion.t17: Number of University Campuses: The main campuses in Turin are:
accordion.t18: Main Campus (Cittadella) Politecnica): The historic heart of the university.
accordion.t21: Castello del Valentino: A beautiful historic castle that also serves as a campus and is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
